name: "Up" in Song Quiz | Something in Common | 10 Questions

questions.text: "Straight up now tell me do you wanna love me forever oh oh oh". Who sang the song "Straight Up"?
questions.explanation:
Paula Abdul.

	Paula Abdul was born June 19, 1962 in San Fernando, California. Before becoming a singer and dancer she was a Laker girl for the L.A. Lakers. She has also been a judge on "American Idol" and "X-Factor" both American versions.

questions.text: Wham! had a song that fits the "up" category. What was it called, "Wake Me Up Before you __________"?
questions.explanation:
Go-go.

	Wham! was a musical duo comprised of George Michael and Andrew Ridgeley. They were a group from 1981-1986. The group was also known as WhamUK (www.wikipedia.com).

questions.text: What did the group Autograph ask us to "turn up" in their song?
questions.explanation:
the radio.

	Autograph was a hard rock/heavy metal band. They performed in the 80s and then again from 2002-2003. "Turn Up the Radio" is their best known song.

questions.text: Who sang the song "Stir It Up" (Not the Bob Marley/Johnny Nash song)?
questions.explanation:
Patti Labelle.

	Patti Labelle was born May 24, 1944 in Philadelphia, PA. She has been singing since 1958.

questions.text: What group told us to "Give It Up" in the 80s?
questions.explanation:
KC and the Sunshine Band.

	KC and the Sunshine Band was formed in 1973 and performed until 1984. They got together again in 1993. They got their name from their lead singer's last name, Casey.

questions.text: "Up Where We Belong" was a song from what 1980s movie?
questions.explanation:
An Officer and a Gentleman.

	"An Officer and Gentlemen" starred Richard Gere. "Up Where We Belong" was sung by Joe Cocker and Jennifer Warnes.

questions.text: Was "Wrap It Up" sung by the Thunderbolts?
questions.explanation:
No.

	"Wrap It Up" was performed by Fabulous Thunderbirds. The Fabulous Thunderbirds have been performing since 1974. They are a blues rock band from Austin, TX.

Cameo.

	Cameo has been performing since 1974. They are a funk group band. They were originally a thirteen member band known as New York City Players. When they became Cameo they dropped to only five members.

questions.text: What "up" song starts with the words "I never knew there'd come a day, when I'd be sayin' to you don't let this good love slip away."?
questions.explanation:
Caught Up In You.

	"Caught Up in You" was performed by .38 Special. .38 Special have been performing since 1974. They got their start in Florida.

questions.text: Who had a hit with "Shake It Up" in 1981?
questions.explanation:
The Cars.

	The Cars performed from 1976 to 1988. They got back together again in 2010. Former band member Benjamin Orr died in 2000 from pancreatic cancer.
